thread.title: 23 Soulful Pictures From The Early Years Of Motown
thread.title_full: 23 Soulful Pictures From The Early Years Of Motown

author: Gabriel H. Sanchez
title: 23 Soulful Pictures From The Early Years Of Motown
text:
In 1959, a young black songwriter from Detroit named Berry Gordy began a record company with a loan of $800 from his family. His vision was unique — just as the assembly lines of Detroit lead the world’s automotive industry, Motown Record Company would become a factory of hit singles and music super stars. In the decade to come, Gordy defined the sound of American music and changed the music world forever. ID: 10583931 View this image ›
Michael Ochs Archives / Getty Images Smokey Robinson and a friend pose for a photo outside of a snowy Hitsville U.S.A., the original Motown headquarters in Detroit, 1967.
ID: 10577684 View this image ›
